programme.desc: Baboon and Giant Otter - Steve and Aneeshwar drive through the baboons' enclosure and say hello to some very mischievous residents. They then meet the giant river otters at feeding time.

programme.title: Swashbuckle S8 Ep24
programme.desc: Captain Captain's Best Bits - In this special compilation episode, Squawk takes us on a journey to find Captain Captain's top Swashbuckle moments. We will see her silliest songs, most marvellous moments and messiest slops.

programme.title: Hey Duggee S2 Ep40
programme.desc: The Wedding Badge - King Tiger has met his perfect partner and he is getting married. It's going to be a royal wedding!! The squirrels are to be special Guests of Honour, but who is King Tiger marrying!?

programme.title: Hey Duggee S2 Ep39
programme.desc: The Getting On Badge - When the squirrels upset the mole by being noisy, Duggee suggests some team building.

programme.title: Hey Duggee S2 Ep38
programme.desc: The Dressing Up Badge - Duggee is wrapping a present because it is Enid's birthday. But the squirrels didn't get her anything!

programme.title: Go Jetters S3 Ep7
programme.desc: Middle of the World City: Ecuador - Glitch and his Glitchbots pretend to be the Go Jetters.

programme.title: Go Jetters S3 Ep6
programme.desc: Go Jetter Heroes: Polar Explorers - When Glitch and Kyan race to the south pole, Glitch's Grimbots steal the pole's marker.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends S24 Ep9
programme.desc: Thomas' Not So Lucky Day - It's Friday the 13th in Italy and Thomas tries to improve his luck by following Lorenzo and Beppe's advice on superstitions.

programme.title: Sarah and Duck S3 Ep15
programme.desc: Planetarium Aquarium - Sarah and Duck go to the aquarium to track down a waving fish.

programme.title: Sarah and Duck S3 Ep16
programme.desc: Shallot Boat - After a night of strong rain, the Shallots set sail on a seafaring adventure.

programme.title: Stan Can S1 Ep40
programme.desc: Snow - It has snowed and almost no one can get about. Stanley builds a snow plough out of surf boards to clear the streets and makes a huge snow hill so that his friends can sledge down it.

programme.title: Stan Can S1 Ep39
programme.desc: Art Park - Fifi and Fred help Stanley clear the park after a storm so it's ready for an Art Competition. The children use the recycled rubbish they found to make their pieces.

programme.title: Kazoops! S1 Ep21
programme.desc: Never Mending Story - The Kazoops decide to replace their broken couch, but Monty doesn't think being broken makes something useless.

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran S1 Ep2
programme.desc: It's time to catch the bus - JoJo and Gran Gran miss their bus home, so the pair settle down to wait for the next one. But getting the bus isn't quite as simple as JoJo thinks it is.

programme.title: Bluey S3 Ep13
programme.desc: Pass the Parcel - Lucky's Dad is outraged that modern Pass the Parcel has a present in every layer and changes the rules back to only having one prize in the middle, but Bingo is forever losing.

programme.title: Bluey S3 Ep14
programme.desc: Perfect - For her Father's Day card, Bluey sets out to draw a picture of herself and her father together. While recalling her favourite memories of playing with Bandit, Bluey struggles with the idea that her drawing must be perfect. Chilli tries to convince Bluey that perfection isn't easy, or absolutely necessary.

programme.title: Bluey S3 Ep15
programme.desc: Explorers - While waiting to be picked up from school, Jack plays at being a sailor trying to find his way back home to Australia. Meanwhile, Jack's Dad has got lost on route to collect him.

programme.title: Hey Duggee S2 Ep43
programme.desc: The Looking After Badge - Outside the clubhouse a large crowd has gathered around a hot air balloon with whisperings that someone is going on an adventure!

programme.title: Hey Duggee S2 Ep42
programme.desc: The Organising Badge - Roly is trying to force a very large plastic ball into the bin, but it flies out and crashes into a tower that Betty has built.

programme.title: Hey Duggee's Squirrel Club S1 Ep7
programme.desc: Song of Peace - Betty recalls the first time she pushed the red button, the Squirrels explore a range of emotions with Happy, Angry Bull tells a not-so-sleepy bedtime story, and the gerbils sing.

programme.title: Go Jetters S3 Ep37
programme.desc: Mars Mission, Chile - Xuli and Foz help NASA after a close encounter with a UFO makes them lose the Mars Rover.

programme.title: Roots & Fruits S1 Ep8
programme.desc: Orange - Live from the Roots & Fruits theatre, it's the daring Orange attempting to cross the stage on a tightrope, if she manages to ignore any distractions.

programme.title: Roots & Fruits S1 Ep7
programme.desc: Cucumber - Live from the Roots & Fruits theatre, it's Cucumber performing Cool Under Pressure while trying to not let any obstacle ruin her calm routine.

programme.title: Supertato S1 Ep40
programme.desc: How to be a Supertato - Supertato shows the Grape Kids a Supertato training film, but Evil Pea sneaks in to take over Tato Tower. The Grape Kids use the rug launcher to eject Evil Pea out of the tower.

programme.title: Supertato S1 Ep41
programme.desc: The Throne Thief - Supertato, Carrot, Broccoli and Chilli are playing when, suddenly, they hear a scream and discover an upset Evil Pea in her freezer. Her throne has been stolen! Who would do such a thing?

programme.title: Teletubbies S1 Ep86
programme.desc: This Way, That Way - The Teletubbies go 'this way, that way' on a Tubby Car journey to the Hidey Hup. The Tubby Spinny goes 'this way, that way' too.

programme.title: Yakka Dee S5 Ep6
programme.desc: Dragon - Dee encourages a friend to say 'dragon' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of dragons!

programme.title: Pop Paper City S1 Ep1
programme.desc: I Can Save The Day - Zip thinks Phoebe could be a superhero, so they craft some awesome superhero cuffs.

programme.title: Messy goes to OKIDO S2 Ep20
programme.desc: Supersonic Messy - Okidoodle is jealous of the new RoboCar, which can go super fast! Will Okidoodle be able to catch up with the RoboCar and earn back Messy's admiration?

programme.title: Bluey S3 Ep38
programme.desc: Cubby - In a funny and honest look at modern family life, Bluey, her sister Bingo and her friends use gameplay to integrate the adult world into their own.

programme.title: Bluey S3 Ep47
programme.desc: Cricket - In a funny and honest look at modern family life, Bluey, her sister Bingo and her friends use gameplay to integrate the adult world into their own.

programme.title: Hey Duggee S5 Ep11
programme.desc: The Cheerleading Badge - The Squirrels find Duggee's cheerleader pompoms, so he shows them his old moves. Time to practice: Duggee at the chess board, the Squirrels as a squad. There's a big match ahead...

programme.title: Hey Duggee S5 Ep5
programme.desc: The Mime Badge - Duggee is encouraging the Squirrels to come outside by gesturing through the window. They don't understand what he's doing and think it's funny. When he comes inside, he explains that he was miming.

programme.title: Hey Duggee's Squirrel Club S1 Ep13
programme.desc: Master of Puppets - At Squirrel Club, there's a story told in blocks, the tale of a first tooth, a fable about changing emotions, and a yarn involving the Squirrels as puppets.

programme.title: Hey Duggee's Squirrel Club S1 Ep1
programme.desc: Cool, Man - At Squirrel Club, Detective Puppy solves the mystery of a missing biscuit, the Rabbits tell us what's cool, and the Squirrels help Delivery Chipmunk with a huge parcel.

programme.title: Go Jetters S3 Ep37
programme.desc: Mars Mission, Chile - Xuli and Foz help NASA after a close encounter with a UFO makes them lose the Mars Rover.

programme.title: Bluey S1 Ep24
programme.desc: Wagon Ride - Bluey can't wait to get to the monkey bars as Dad takes her and Bingo on a wagon ride to the park. But her patience is tested when Dad keeps stopping to chat with other grown-ups.

programme.title: Bluey S2 Ep27
programme.desc: Seesaw - Dad has rudely plonked himself on one end of the seesaw. So Bluey and Bingo round up the entire playground to help move him off, but they still need to find one more friend.

programme.title: Andy's Baby Animal Missions S1 Ep15
programme.desc: Andy and the Black Bear Cubs - In this episode, Andy, Jen and Scout head to Alaska, America on a baby animal mission to help rescue some black bear cubs high up in a tree. Along the way, Andy meets a grumpy Arctic ground squirrel.

programme.title: BIZ STREAM
programme.desc: Shoring Up Short-Handed Kitchens: This episode features new services and cooking equipment designed to help restaurants in Japan overcome a deepening labor shortage.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH 5min.
programme.desc: Crisp, hot, and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Summer #5
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony #3 Autumn
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, two naginata (polearms) associated with legendary warriors: Benkei and Tomoe Gozen.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O'Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: CINEMATIC JOURNEY
programme.desc: Kyle Card hikes along the 1000km trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japanwhere he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Tokyo's Largest Indian Community
programme.desc: In Edogawa City, where 40% of Tokyo's Indian population reside, a cultural exchange program gives Japanese residents the chance to visit Indian homes as well as facilities run by Indians.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: Cycle Around Japan has teamed up with Taiwan's public broadcaster, PTS, for a three-part series airing this fall. Experience Taiwan's lush scenery, and meet guardians of traditional culture.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: Mencari Ramli Musim Ke - 4 - 10

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Garcia vs. Onama - Prelims
programme.desc: The month of November opens with a return to the UFC APEX and a UFC Fight Night event headlined by streaking featherweights Steve Garcia and David Onama. Fighting out of Albuquerque, New Mexico, Garcia touches down for his first main event assignment riding a six-fight winning streak with five finishes. Not to be outdone, the 31-year-old Onama enters having won four straight, including victories over ascending prospect Gabriel Sangtos and rankings mainstay Giga Chikadze.

programme.title: UFC 321: Aspinall vs. Gane - Prelims
programme.desc: The UFC heavyweight world championship will be on the line on October 25 at Etihad Arena in Abu Dhabi when Tom Aspinall defends his undisputed crown for the first time against Ciryl Gane in the main event of UFC 321. England's Aspinall has ended his last three wins by knockout, including an interim title-winning effort over Sergei Pavlovich and a successful defense against Curtis Blaydes. This fall, he will face another stern test in French star Gane, a former interim champ looking to add undisputed goal to his trophy case after back-to-back wins over Serghei Spivac and Alexander Volkov

Not to be outdone, the 31-year-old Onama enters having won four straight, including victories over ascending prospect Gabriel Sangtos and rankings mainstay Giga Chikadze.
